p: SEM studies were carried out to observe the morphological changes of bacteria, which were treated with MIC value of A. argyi essential oil. Cells were harvested by centrifugation for 15 min at 5000 r/min, and washed three times with 0.1 M phosphate buffer solution (PBS, PH 7.4). The treatment of bacterial cells and observations of SEM was followed by the reported study [ 26]. All the samples were coated with gold in a sputter coater, followed by microscopic examinations using a SEM system (S-3000H; Hitachi Ltd., Tokyo, Japan).
